titles.title: MSPB Temporary Term Extension Act
MSPB Temporary Term Extension Act
MSPB Temporary Term Extension Act
MSPB Temporary Term Extension Act

To provide that the term of office of certain members of the Merit Systems Protection Board shall be extended by a period of 1 year, to limit such members from concurrently holding positions within the Federal Government, and for other purposes.
To provide that the term of office of certain members of the Merit Systems Protection Board shall be extended by a period of 1 year, and for other purposes.
MSPB Temporary Term Extension Act

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Reform.
Mr. Connolly moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1235.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

committee.name: Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

term.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

bill.summary:
MSPB Temporary Term Extension Act
This bill extends for one year the term of office of an individual who is currently serving as a member of the Merit Systems Protection Board.
